dc:description:
ACTA1 was first reported in relation to autosomal dominant hypertrophic cardiomyopathy in 2001 (Lim et al., PMID: 11583900). Summary of case level and experimental data: 1.5 points. Only 3 cases of HCM have been reported: 2 of the cases were in patients with nemaline myopathy and the third case was in a patient with congenital myopathy with cores. Therefore, there is no genetic evidence fo HCM alone. Evidence supporting this gene-disease relationship includes  expression data showing altered gene expression in patients, and functional assays showing variants in ACTA1 result in decreased binding affinity for α-actinin compared to wild type. No convincing evidence for a causal role for ACTA1 in autosomal dominant hypertrophic cardiomyopathy has been reported. Although this gene-disease association is supported by the aforementioned expression studies and functional assays, no reports
have directly implicated the gene in humans.

evidence.dc:description: K336E mutant showed decreased binding affinity for α-actinin compared to wild type. ACTN2 has a moderate association with HCM.
evidence.rdfs:label: D'Amico 2006 P.I.1

evidence.dc:description: The study focuses on characterizing the D2 strain as a promising model for HCM and there are no other papers validating this yet. 0 points assigned since other studies confirm upregulation in humans (see Lim, 2001).
RNA-seq on hearts from D2 mice (HCM strain) showed an upregulation of α1-actin compared to B6 mice (reference strain).
evidence.rdfs:label: Zhao 2015 Expression1

evidence.dc:description:
Left ventricular septal tissue obtained by myomectomy of HCM patient and a corresponding segment was taken from an age- and gender- matched normal donor heart.

Subtraction hybridization between mRNA pools extracted from normal heart and HCM heart showed an upregulation of ACTA1 in the HCM heart, which was confirmed by Northern blot. Upregulation was further confirmed in six additional HCM hearts.
evidence.rdfs:label: Lim 2001 Expression1

evidence.dc:description:
Western blot on human heart tissue (interventricular septum) from 6 patients with HOCM (myectomy) showed an increase in skeletal muscle α-actin compared to 4 control donor hearts.

This study also showed that thin filaments containing actin that were isolated from normal and HOCM heart muscle were indistinguishable when subjected to an in vitro motility assay.
evidence.rdfs:label: Copeland 2010 Expression1

evidence.dc:description: Actin was isolated from muscle biopsy and 2D electrophoresis revealed 28% mutant actin. Affinity of acttin for the Z-line alpha-actinin was reduced 10 fold. No other testing to determine whether mutation was present in known HCM genes. This is the first report on HCM associated with nemaline myopathy and ACTA1 mutation.

evidence.rdfs:label: D'Amico 2006 Case1
evidence.detectionMethod: Genomic sequencing of ACTA1 identified mutation. Not present in peripheral blood DNA of either parent.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Nemaline myopathy, Hypotonia, heart murmur, MWT (IVS) = 6.7mm, died suddenly at 3 years
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Mutations of ACTC and TPM3 were ruled out.

evidence.dc:description: Parents negative for variant. Mutation not found in 200 normal control chromosomes. No other testing to determine whether mutation was present in known HCM genes. 0 points since this patient has nemaline myopathy.

evidence.rdfs:label: Kim 2011 Case1
evidence.detectionMethod: Variant found by direct sequencing of genomic DNA.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: nemaline myopathy, RVOT obstruction, max wall thickness RV = 6.5mm, elevated serum creatine kinase

evidence.dc:description: No other testing to determine whether mutation was present in known HCM genes. Reported as p.E334A but really p.K336E?

evidence.rdfs:label: Kaindl 2004 II:2
evidence.detectionMethod: All 6 protein encoding exons of ACTA1 were sequenced in patient II:2. Exon 7 sequenced in family members. Variant not found in 50 control individuals.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Diagnosed with central core disease in infancy.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Mutations in 3 core disease loci RYR1, MYH7, and SEPN1 ruled out.
